reviews.sentence: nice hotel on the water. A great place to stay on the water near great restaurants in Jack London Square. If you are here on Sunday do not miss the farmers market. Friendly staff low key atmosphere. Jack London Square bars and restaurants great Sunday market. Bathrooms could use updating.

Great balcony room with view of marina. Love this hotel because of its setting. Only hotel right on the water in the middle of Jack London Square. Prefer the balcony rooms on the marina with a sitting area. Beds are comfortable. Has Keurig coffee maker and provides 2 complimentary bottles of water. Restaurant and bar is good. Excellent specialty drinks in bar. Great fun to just relax on the restaurants outdoor patio and watch festivities in the area. Lots of events scheduled for this summer 2015 street dancing USS Potomac cruises farmers market wine expo and more. The landing for the Golden Gate Ferry is right next door. Can easily walk to Yoshis. fun and well known Japanese restaurant with small jazz theater. Cons do not get street side rooms because of a nearby rail track although the hotel provides all rooms with earplugs the valet parking is a whopping 25.

Not well run canot recommend for experienced travelers. Website oversels the beauty of the place it needs some maintenance for old age. Drapes do not close very well carpet is older and the views are crummy once you look past a row of boats to the cargo port and dirt hills of Alameda. The staff lets people use the pool who are not guests of the property and our room was 4 ft above the pool party that night. I literally had to wrap the pillow around my head to go to sleep. On the bright side a tip is to certainly use the complimentary shuttle that runs on the half hour for about 8 hours during the week ONLY. It goes a short radius but will get you over to Lake Merit with a much nicer area. Walk the lake enjoy the restaurant there etc. It is only 4 miles away. Skip the wine and cheese at 50. it is cheesy and people are grabbing. Did I say this place is not for the upscale traveler.
great. view comfortable bed easy access to ferya very simple breakfast offering would have been nice since coffee shops in the area did not open until later.

Everything was good except for the noisy train and that colored everything. The lively location and the very good restaurant. I hated the noisy train. I was awakened two times during the night and will try the warerside if I ever stay again.

Wonderful Experience. From the moment we pulled up to the valet parking we were greeted with warmth and excellent service. The gentleman who parked our car also drove us to our event that night and was really wonderful. There is a small lobby that is very inviting and comfortable. In the lobby was ice water coffee and tea set up all day along with a fireplace and computers for use. The restaurant bar area was really nice. There was live music on the Friday night we were there and it overlooks Jack London Square and the waterfront. We did not get a chance to eat there but did try their Its It cocktail and it was amazing. everything looked really good. We had the opportunity to stay in a Penthouse Suite and it was unbelievable. Huge wall of windows overlooking the water with a long deck area with furniture and a heater. It has a full kitchen full living room extremely comfortable king bed in front of a fireplace and a bathroom with a jetted tub surrounded in windows with a view of the water. The staff even sent up some champagne and chocolates we felt like royalty. We also really enjoyed Jack London Square and all the great eateries around. We will definitely stay here again. All the staff was professional and kind and I am not sure I have ever seen a room that spectacular. Thank you to the management who made our stay so wonderful.

Beautiful view. Waterfront Hotel has wonderful room service friendly and helpful staff members and a great location on the water in Jack London Square. Parking is cheaper here than some other nearby hotels that do not offer rom service. Woke up this morning to have my excellent breakfast delivered to my room. I ate while watching the boats sail by past my window.

Nice hotel except for the active train line. Besides hearing trains roar through around 6 times a day and night it was an ok hotel in an otherwise good location. Jack London square is like the Fishermans Wharf of Oakland. You got ta love trains though. Coffee shop attached Jack London square is cool for a tourist area restaurants and bowling and stuff to do. The best Jazz Dinner club in the US is in walking distance. Get rid of the trains outside the front door.
Great location. Waterfront hotel is in a great location in Jack London Square. Within walking distance to great restaurants clubs and a beautiful bay view.

Lovely waterfront location. Lovely waterfront view and great location. there is also a free shuttle within 4 miles or a free bus that takes you a little further. Food is good in the restaurant with very friendly service. Breakfast is a bit of a disaster not enough staff and there is no service. More like an understaffed coffee shop than a hotel although the quality of the food is good. The design of the hotel rooms is a little shabby although always just on the right side of retro.

Overpriced bad service and dirty. Checked in for a 1 night stay the receptionist could not have been more dismissive when all she said was Picture ID and Credit Card. No smile no welcome. Had to meet someone for a drink and was told the hotel has no bar go to the sports bar down the road then I passed the hotel bar and restaurant. Bathroom had used previous guest toiletries in it opened. Bathroom Trash can had previous guests dirty trash in it disgusting. Will never stay here again and it was 250 for the night.

Handy. Stayed here over St Patricks weekend. Clean attractive decor. Great fitness center with free weights elliptical. In the heart of Jack London Square. Make note that Amtrak passes a block away however double insulated sliders eliminate all noise. We were surprised how effective the soundproofing was. Friendly staff. did not use restaurant save for a nightcap one evening. Friendly bar staff.

Last Minute Stay. Great location at Jack London Square. Rooms were spacious and remodeled. Our bed needed the mattress changed as it had outlived it is life span too too soft. Would not eat at Lungamare. We went for breakfast and only about 3 tables occupied. Waited over 30 minutes for food to come out and then the poached eggs were cold. The amount of lox served lox bagel was a joke. It barely covered 12 of a bagel slice. They offered a side of lox for 40. In the end they discounted our bill. Great location Comfortable room. New chef for Lungamare.

Exceptional. The staff were courteous and helpful. The room was clean. There were also earplugs in the room which was good because Plank was a little loud. We did not try out the restaurant but it looked good. N a.

Disappointing visit. The room was comfortable. There was no shuttle service between the hotel and the train station. In spite of advertising free breakfast there was no breakfast available at the hotel. We were given directions to a restaurant where we had a good breakfast but had to pay for it of course. Staff called taxis to pick us up at station and take us to station which we had to pay for. I am not sure we would stay there again.

Great location. We arrived did nt get the room we booked they rectified the situation and put us in a great view room. Everything was great from there. The rooms were clean and spacious and beds were comfortable. Alot of restaurants near the hotel.

Good hotel poor breakfast. This hotel is in a superb location right on Jack London Square. Our room was very good well equipped modern and very clean. The in room internet access was unreliable in the evening and non functional the following morning but reception gave us a conference password that overcame the problem. The breakfast available in the café at Lungomare left us seriously unimpressed. For example the eggs sausages that I ordered were OK but accompanied by a huge mound of potatoes that swamped the whole dish.

WaterFront Review. I enjoyed my stay at the Waterfront Hotel close to bowling and resturants. I loved the view access to the ferry. The bar staff was funny. We enjoyed the fireplace and cocktails and the coffee sent us on our way that mroning.

Good. Location and bar are great. A good number of fun places within walking distance along the waterfront. Decor is a little dated though in decent shape. I opted for the automatic check out and did not realize until a few days later that apparently someone elses restaurant and room service charges had been added to my bill. They fixed it fairly quickly when I called.
Good. LoudLots of bars and restaurants. Train tracks.
